page.title: 08The Queen's Champion
page.content: The Champion lives at Sonvelsby, a scattered village and parish 2 miles south of Horncastle. It has 153 inhabitants. 2142 acres are owned by Sir Henry Dymoke, the Queen's Champion. The park has an entrance known as the Lion Gateway, a stone arch with a rampant lion on top. It was probably built by Sir Robert Dymoke in the early 16th century. There is no school or chapel or real centre of Sonvelsby. It does not have a Parish Council but a parish meeting is held once a year. Robert Marmion had the manor given to him by William the Conqueror. When he died he left the title and manor to his daughter Joan who married John Dymoke. The present lord of the manor is the 17th Dymoke to live there. He is required to go to Coronations only.
